comment: Yes, Professor Yan doesn't speak English very well and pretty much reads from the slides, BUT in graduate school, the onus is on you to learn the material. I am NOT a math guy and Dr. Yan made every effort to pass this class. He truly cares about his students and I would not have graduated if it wasn't for him. 10/10 WOULD TAKE AGAIN!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: He may be a good professor in person, but do NOT take him online! The videos are completely unintelligible. He does respond to email, although not immediately, but was completely unresponsive in the discussion forum set up for the class. We were pretty much on our own throughout the class. I can't believe I paid to teach myself this subject.

Very absent in online forums and with feedback during summer semester class. The pre-recorded lectures are direct reading from slides in extremely broken english. If the prof is not going to be involved in the online class they should just not offer it...

Out of all the options for CS profs he is the best so far. He is friendly, cooperative, and willing to slow down lecture if you can't understand. He does present a language barrier in class, but will slow down if you don't understand. His tests are only hard, if you don't read the material. The slides will not help you pass the class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY

comment: Sweet guy, has a strong accent but makes sure to try to understand your question. Very forgiving, says he won't let you make up assignments (but he will). He's very generous on the tests. The quizzes can all be found in the back of the book, so study the "Tests" written in the back of the book. Doesn't matter if you code final in Assembly or C.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: There is a language barrier, Prof Yan is a great guy, although he and students have very different perspectives. Don't expect hand-holding, this is a participation class. You are supposed to use your intuition and read specs, he is simply the guide to the specs. Depends on if this is the best way to learn for you. Labs are important.

This guy is probably one of the worst professors I've had. His accent is too strong and his teaching does not flow. It's actually easier to skip class and try and teach the material yourself. The labs are not hard if you start on it before class. Homework and quizzes are online. Tests are hard and his reviews do not help. DO NOT TAKE!

I can't understand 96% of what he says in lecture. The labs are pretty easy if you prepare for them beforehand, but you'll be confused if you don't try to teach yourself the material. Tests are hard. Homework and quizzes are relatively easy. Take at your own risk.

Had to take a recording of his lecture to show people how impossible it is to understand him. I found that the only words you could understand was when he said individual letters or numbers. Avoid at all costs unless you want to teach everything to yourself. Test averages were F with the people getting an A or B being less than 5.
He has a strong accent. You will do good with the class, if you are good at self teaching. Class is test heavy and the tests are not too hard (again, if you are good at learning stuff on your own).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--TEST HEAVY

comment: Brand new teacher who has a lot to learn. Horrible accent. Assumes the class understands everything he says during lectures. Gets mad when students ask questions. TAs either don't know anything about the lab or give misinformation. Class average for both tests were 32 and 36. Involves a group project that no one knew how to do. No curve at the end.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Tests are tough

comment: Ruuuuun for the hills. His accent is not hard to understand - it's impossible. He's completely unintelligible. What's worse, he seems lost and confused half the time in his lectures. So far, our class avg for tests are 48 and 43. If you're cool with learning everything from the book and depending on a huge curve at the end, sign up. Otherwise...

He's a new professor at KSU, but overall he's knowledgeable about the subject. Accent is tough to understand but it's not too bad.. The Labs are a pain though, even the TA's don't know what they're doing. The only good things are that each test is worth 10%, so you could bomb all the tests and still pass. He also gives u chances for making up labs
